security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill with no executable code. Provides instructions for extracting coding standards from config files. No file access, network calls, command execution, or environment variable access. Zero attack surface.

content.user_title: Extract coding standards from project configs
content.value_statement: New contributors often guess coding conventions instead of following established project standards. This skill parses CONTRIBUTING.md, linter configs, and editor settings to return a complete standards summary for consistent contributions.
actual_capabilities: Parse CONTRIBUTING.md for commit formats and branch naming rules
Extract formatting rules from .editorconfig and Prettier configs
Read ESLint, Ruff, and other linter configuration settings
Check for git hooks in .husky and pre-commit configs
Compile all standards into structured JSON output
limitations: Only reads standard config file formats (JSON, YAML, TOML, INI)
Does not execute linting or formatting tools
Requires AI agent to have file system access to target project
Cannot validate that code actually follows extracted rules

use_cases.title: Onboard to codebase
use_cases.description: Get complete list of coding conventions before writing first line of code

use_cases.title: Audit project standards
use_cases.description: Verify all project standards are documented and accessible in one place

use_cases.title: Follow project conventions
use_cases.description: Ensure AI-generated code matches established project style guidelines

prompt_templates.title: Basic extraction
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the standards-extraction skill to parse all config files in this project and return the coding standards summary.

prompt_templates.title: Formatting focus
prompt_templates.prompt: Extract only the formatting rules (indentation, line length, quotes, semicolons) from this project's .editorconfig and Prettier config.

prompt_templates.title: Linting rules
prompt_templates.prompt: Parse the ESLint and linter configurations in this project and list the key enabled rules and extended configs.

prompt_templates.title: Full contribution guide
prompt_templates.prompt: Extract the complete contribution guidelines including commit message format, branch naming, PR requirements, and testing expectations.

output_examples.input: Use standards-extraction to parse the project config files

best_practices: Run extraction on the target project root directory for complete results
Combine with code review skills to validate contributions match standards
Use extracted rules as input for automated linting in CI pipelines
anti_patterns: Skipping CONTRIBUTING.md because it might be outdated
Assuming generic coding standards without checking project configs
Reporting formatting rules that contradict actual config files

faq.question: Which config files does this skill support?
faq.answer: Supports ESLint, Prettier, Ruff, EditorConfig, .husky, pre-commit, pyproject.toml, and common markdown contribution guides.

faq.question: Does this skill execute any code on my system?
faq.answer: No. This is a prompt-based skill that provides instructions. It does not run executables or access files directly.

faq.question: Can I use this with Claude Code CLI?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. File access depends on the tool you use.

faq.question: What output formats are available?
faq.answer: Supports JSON, markdown, and toon formats. Use the OUTPUT_FORMAT variable to specify your preference.

faq.question: Does this send data to external servers?
faq.answer: No. This skill only provides instructions to the AI. No network calls are made by the skill itself.

faq.question: How is this different from running eslint --print-config?
faq.answer: This skill reads config files and contribution guides to explain standards. It does not run the actual tools or validate code.
